result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Dremler, Joshua J.

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM - cases called - 21CF187, 22CF64 and 22CF68.  Defendant Joshua J. Dremler appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach appeared by video for Joshua J. Dremler.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Tlusty regarding plea agreement.  Court questions Atty Fehrenbach/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Fehrenbach/Defendant.  Defendant consents to appearing via Zoom.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Defendant acknowledges the restrictions that go along with a felony conviction.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Joint recommendation.  Statement by Atty Tlusty/Atty Fehrenbach/Court regarding sentencing.  Post conviction rights given.    

21CF187 - DRI.

22CF64 - DRI. 

22CF68 - Plea to Count 1 is guilty.  Plea to Count 2 is guilty.  Count 3 - DRI.  Court orders on Count 1 - s/w 24 months probation (consecutive to all other sentences) with conditions of probation being absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages, may not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol, AODA assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations, complete any counseling as deemed appropriate by probation agent, submit DNA sample and cc/sc.  Court orders on Count 2 - 60 days in the Lincoln County Jail with Huber - imposed and stayed.  Court further orders on Count 2 - 24 months probation (consecutive to all other sentences; concurrent to Count 1) with conditions of probation being the same as Count 1.  No sentence credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:32 AM - cases called - 21CF187, 22CF64 and 22CF68.  Defendant Joshua J. Dremler appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach appeared by video for Joshua J. Dremler.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin not in court.  Court notes a special prosecutor will need be to assigned to these cases.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding conflict.  Statement by Atty Fehrenbach - did not have notice of the need for a special prosecutor and will waive the issue.  Statement by the Court.  Court will adjourn this matter.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:00 PM - cases called - 22CF64 and 22CF68.  Defendant Joshua J. Dremler appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding status of these matters.  Court addresses Defendant - right to counsel.  Response by Defendant - does qualify for a public defender.  Court will proceed with the preliminary hearings.  Deputy Conner Monk duly sworn and testifies in 22CF64.  Direct by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Defendant identified by Deputy Monk.  State requests the Court take judicial notice of the bond in Lincoln County Case No. 21CF187.  Court takes judicial notices.  Court addresses Defendant.  No questions or argument by Defendant.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Deputy Mariah Vogel duly sworn and testifies in 22CF68.  Direct by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Defendant identified by Deputy Vogel.  State requests the Court take judicial notice of the bond in Lincoln County Case No. 21CF187.  Court takes judicial notices.  Court addresses Defendant.  No questions or argument by Defendant.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Bond will continue in each matter.
Arraignment scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:31 PM - cases called - 22CF68 and 22CF64.  Defendant Joshua J. Dremler appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Kurt Zengler for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Defendant needs to contact the public defender office.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Defendant requests timely preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.

1:13 PM - cases called - 22CF64 and 21CF187 (Branch 1 matter).  Defendant Joshua J. Dremler appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  State moves to quash the warrant in 21CF187.  Court quashes the warrant in 21CF187.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court questions Defendant.  Responses by Defendant.  Court sets bond in 22CF64 and reinstates bond in 21CF187.  Court will adjourn 22CF64 to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
